body_html:
I was under the impression that @yongtang was digging into the test failures on Windows. Looking at the failures I see:

FAIL: testStringSplitWithUtf8AndEmptyDelimiter (__main__.StringSplitOpTest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:/tf_jenkins/workspace/tensorflow-pr-win-cmake-py/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/string_split_op_test.py", line 221, in testStringSplitWithUtf8AndEmptyDelimiter
    b"\xE4\xB8\x96", b"\xE7\x95\x8C"])
  File "C:\Program Files\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\framework\test_util.py", line 1148, in assertAllEqual
    np.testing.assert_array_equal(a, b)
  File "C:\Program Files\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\numpy\testing\utils.py", line 871, in assert_array_equal
    verbose=verbose, header='Arrays are not equal')
  File "C:\Program Files\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\numpy\testing\utils.py", line 796, in assert_array_compare
    raise AssertionError(msg)
AssertionError: 
Arrays are not equal

(mismatch 100.0%)
 x: array([b'\x00\x82\xa8', b'\x00\xa5\xbd', b'\x00\xb8\x96', b'\x00\x95\x8c'], dtype=object)
 y: array([b'\xe6\x82\xa8', b'\xe5\xa5\xbd', b'\xe4\xb8\x96', b'\xe7\x95\x8c'], 
      dtype='|S3')

Suggesting things about the dtype of numpy arrays of strings that I am not well versed in.
Will have to look into it. If anyone has ideas, much appreciated. Otherwise will ask around internally as well.

body:
I was under the impression that @yongtang was digging into the test failures on Windows. Looking at the failures I see:

```
FAIL: testStringSplitWithUtf8AndEmptyDelimiter (__main__.StringSplitOpTest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:/tf_jenkins/workspace/tensorflow-pr-win-cmake-py/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/string_split_op_test.py", line 221, in testStringSplitWithUtf8AndEmptyDelimiter
    b"\xE4\xB8\x96", b"\xE7\x95\x8C"])
  File "C:\Program Files\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\framework\test_util.py", line 1148, in assertAllEqual
    np.testing.assert_array_equal(a, b)
  File "C:\Program Files\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\numpy\testing\utils.py", line 871, in assert_array_equal
    verbose=verbose, header='Arrays are not equal')
  File "C:\Program Files\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\numpy\testing\utils.py", line 796, in assert_array_compare
    raise AssertionError(msg)
AssertionError: 
Arrays are not equal

(mismatch 100.0%)
 x: array([b'\x00\x82\xa8', b'\x00\xa5\xbd', b'\x00\xb8\x96', b'\x00\x95\x8c'], dtype=object)
 y: array([b'\xe6\x82\xa8', b'\xe5\xa5\xbd', b'\xe4\xb8\x96', b'\xe7\x95\x8c'], 
      dtype='|S3')
```

Suggesting things about the `dtype` of numpy arrays of strings that I am not well versed in.
Will have to look into it. If anyone has ideas, much appreciated. Otherwise will ask around internally as well.
